sense.name: the event of coming to a stop, ending something
sense.commentary: HALT[+event][+transition][+to_stoppage][+complete] Note: refers to the transition of stopping, not the ongoing state of inactivity
sense.examples: The bus came to a halt just before going over the cliff. Everything came to a complete halt in John's life after his accident. (figurative extension) The machine came to a halt when the plug came out of the wall.

sense.name: an ongoing state of stoppage, inactivity
sense.commentary: HALT[+state][+ongoing][+stoppage][+of_activity] Note: implies the span of inactivity, not the transitional moment to it. (Sense 1)
sense.examples: This halt in the negotiating process is hurting both sides. The halt in the arms race of the past decade may be in jeopardy.

sense.name: to order, demand
sense.examples: He has called a halt to any further shipments of oil to that nation. The community has called for a halt to the drug dealers infestation of their neighborhood.
